definition: magic trick
trick/drama/play/show/CL:齣|出[chu1],場|场[chang3],臺|台[tai2]
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
to perform conjuring tricks/to conjure/to juggle
hat trick (when one player scores three goals)

sentences.english: Or a juggler hates a shove.
This cantrip cannot duplicate the effect of any other power.
sentences.chinese: 這個戲法無法複製任何其他威能的效果。

sentences.english: They were watching me as they would watch a conjurer about to perform a trick.
sentences.chinese: 他們看着我，就想看着魔術師變戲法一樣。

sentences.english: Thanks to the magic of the Internet, you can watch the trick again.
sentences.chinese: 多虧有了互聯網的魔力，你可以再看看這個戲法。

sentences.english: Klinsmann was the only player to hit(score)a hat trick in World Cup Final.
sentences.chinese: 克林斯曼是世界盃決賽中唯一上演帽子戲法的球員。

sentences.english: Juggling with four clubs requires mastering the three-club juggle.
sentences.chinese: 有四支球隊雜耍需要掌握三個俱樂部變戲法。

sentences.english: He made a fortune through financial legerdemain .
sentences.chinese: 他通過一些資本運作“戲法”發了大財。

sentences.english: But would such a sleight of hand really stand up to legal scrutiny in the aftermath of Armageddon?
sentences.chinese: 但這種戲法真的經得起末日審判的法律審查嗎？

sentences.english: This trick demands sleight of hand.
The conjuror's magic delighted the children.
sentences.chinese: 魔術師的戲法逗樂了孩子們。

sentences.english: Broiled chicken disappeared from before us like magic.
sentences.chinese: 燒雞像變戲法似地從我們眼前消失了。

sentences.english: The juggler was the amazement of the whole city.
sentences.chinese: 變戲法者使市民們歎爲觀止。

sentences.english: I started doing tricks for the kids at school.
sentences.chinese: 後來，我開始在學校裏給其他孩子變戲法。

sentences.english: Please give me your bag and the juggler in it. I will give you a package of gold coins for it.
sentences.chinese: 請把你的口袋和口袋裏那個變戲法的給我吧。

sentences.english: They brought back to my mind, in a flash, the thr juggles .
sentences.chinese: 他們頓時使我回想起那三個變戲法的。

definition: to be chivalrous
to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to include impromptu comic material in opera performance (idiom); to jest/buffoonery
to fight/to exchange blows
to uphold virtue and condemn evil (idiom)
commendation speech/eulogy/ode
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
to be invincible/unrivalled
folk story/folktale
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
to make a significant advance in one's career (idiom)/to get one's big break
hard to distinguish real from imitation
mythological story/myth
